links.description: "Only those that risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go." - T.S. Eliot I was reminded of that quote recently as I was reading a great piece by Tim Duy: "Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell took to the podium at the annual Jackson Hole monetary conference, delivering a message of support for the central bank's policy of ongoing gradual interest-rate increases.

$AAPL Uncle Warren explains the enduring power of stock buybacks for long-term investors: https://finance.yahoo.com/news/warren-buffett-explains-enduring-power-120000163.html

links.title: Warren Buffett explains the enduring power of stock buybacks for long-term investors
links.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway began buying back its own stock in the past decade and has long benefited from share repurchases of stocks it owns, most recently, Apple. The billionaire investor has long believed that when executed for the right reasons, buybacks are good.
